Funds are available as a result of a series of efforts over the past months to de-scope contracts and draw down troops in Afghanistan. Accordingly, initial FY 2021 contract estimates have encountered some element of decreased costs and this has created excess funding that is available for realignment. Specific funding is available from the LOGCAP V contract, Afghanistan Rotary Wing, and Combined Security Transition Command — Afghanistan (CSTC-A) reduced requirements. Although the Army expects remaining costs for the drawdown, including transportation and retrograde costs, the Army has not identified drawdown costs that affect this asset. This is Title IX OCO budget funding.

Funds are available from the Regional Centers due to un-executable implementation requirements associated with the Functional Center for Security Studies in Irregular Warfare this fiscal year. This is a congressional special interest item. This is base budget funding.

Funds are required to support the President’s decision to relocate Afghan special immigrant visa (SIV) applicants and their families to safe havens in conjunction with the withdrawal of military forces from Afghanistan. This reprogramming request is in response to the U.S. Department of State request for the DoD to provide temporary housing, sustainment, and other humanitarian assistance to the SIV applicants and their families.

Funds are available from SAG 110 (Iraq) due to the confluence of a reduction in new orders of major end items and the backlog of CTEF-Iraq equipment exacerbated by the COVID-19 outbreak. This is Title IX OCO budget funding.

Funds from Coalition Support Funds (CSF) are available since they are scheduled to expire at the end of FY 2021 and the Department does not anticipate receiving any additional CSF claims against which it could apply these funds. This is Title IX OCO budget funding.
